question: Hallucinations are produced by-
exp: Ans. is 'a" i. e.. Amphetamineso Amphetamine psychosis mimic paranoid schizophrenia. There may be deleusions and hallucinations. Amphetamine abuseo Amphetamine is a powerful CNS stimulator. It acts on norepinephrine release in brain, along with an action on release of dopamine and serotonine. Amphetamine abuse may cause: -Acute intoxication: - Symptoms of acute intoxication are: -Cardiovascular: - Tachycardia, hypertension, Cardiac failure. Cardiovascular shock. CNS: - Euphoria, seizures, hyperpyrexia, tremors, ataxia, pupillary dilatation. Neuropsychiatric: - Anxiety, panic, insomnia, restlessness, irritability. Paranoid hallucinatory syndrome: - Closely mimics paranoid schizophrenia. It is also known as amphetamine psychosis. There may be idea of reference, delusion of persecution. Auditory or visual hallucination in a setting of clear consciousness. Chronic abuse: - It causes: -Severe and compulsive craving for the drug. Cycle of *runs * (heavy use for several days) followed by *Crashes * (stopping the drug use). Tactile hallucination (formination).
